body: Might be useful to have @version tag in each file, but do not add it manually to each class, but just substituting it on some build phase, reading current version from graddle properties, the similar way we do for PXF api version.
+1. It it better to make it clear that kerberos mode check only works for HFDS/YARN. We don't check kerberos configuration for HAWQ itself at present.

cc @changleicn, @yaoj2, @huor, @liming01 

ps: I separate this pr into three commits with specific meaning, plz review.
@vraghavan78 GA build was cut yesterday. so this can only be after 2.0. the master branch will be open for commit today.
@vraghavan78 , merged, please close this PR. Thanks.

1) You might want to avoid using the absolute path of lcov, etc. (users could install them anywhere).
2)  Does the code check whether lcov packages have been installed at the configure stage?
I am closing this PR without merging it. The test I had in GPDB cause failure in some machine due to missing locale. I will fix the test and open the PR again for HAWQ.

1) It would be good to support "make unittest"  for hawq and its dependencies as we have "make unittest" for libyarn, libhdfs3, pxf and "make unittest-check" for hawq itself and contrib/hawq-hadoop.

2) Need to do clean up for more intermediate "_.o", "_.gcno" files in "make distclean" and "make clean". 

Below are some uncleaned intermediate files after "make distclean":

2.1) *.gcno files

```
$ find . -name "*.gcno"
./contrib/formatter_fixedwidth/fixedwidth.gcno
./tools/bin/src/stream/stream.gcno
```

2.2) *.o files

```
$ find . -name "*.o"
./contrib/formatter_fixedwidth/fixedwidth.o
./src/bin/gpfdist/fstream.o
./src/bin/gpfdist/gfile.o
./src/bin/gpfdist/gpfdist.o
./src/bin/gpfdist/transform.o
```

I think it is just a right workaround solution, but `libyarn` and `libhdfs3` use a makefile wrapper which is dangerous for portability.
I think maybe a better solution is to write a shell/python script outside(transparent to user) that could build `libyarn` and `libhdfs3` before building `hawq`. Of course, the script should support option parse.

To Huor, I checked the source code. It seems that it is easy to add some Makefile targets for the issues you mentioned. To better track them, I'd leave them to another issue.

To xunzhang,  yes, we should do them in configure or make to make the build of libhdfs3 and libyarn transparent to users. Currently doing it in "make pre_config" (dependency of "make all") seems to be better to handle. Maybe I misunderstood your words.

Thanks all.
Hi @xinzweb,  I have merged it, please close this PR. Thanks.

Usage:
1. Build Gtest/Gmock:
`cd ${HAWQ_HOME}depends/thirdparty/googletest; mkdir build; cd build;`
`cmake ..; make -j8; sudo make install;`
2. Compile Test Code:
`make feature_test;`
3. clean
`make feature_test_clean;`
@paul-guo- plz sync `configure.in` asap. Any problem, ping me.

nice job with the refactoring of hawq types !
+!

@changleicn plz review [this file](https://github.com/xunzhang/incubator-hawq/blob/1dc1d209a22e695c34c02116b9a3e24142891372/depends/thirdparty/ImportLog).
As we discussed before, in this pr I add a file named `ImportLog` inside `depends/thirdparty` folder to record the package importing information.
Merging this PR, will address bytea type in separate story.
+1 Overall it is good, except that a more meaningful name instead of execute1 would be better
used void execute(const std::string &sql, bool check = true) instead
